title: What do you hate about Michael Jackson haters? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nothing. I ignore them. To each his/ her own. This question is provoking more hate talk. There Are those who accuse others of being haters when in fact they like Michael’s music but they do not like a lot of the decisions Michael made in life, especially with the drugs, which of course ended up killing him. I am not sure this is a sincere question as one of the answers is a directed personal attack on people “who ask and answer their own questions and are twisted wanna be psychologists” . I’m pretty sure the questioner Marina is referring to me, as this has become a vendetta, but I am not a wanna be. I was a nurse, and a psych nurse as well, thankfully retired. I didn’t see that she had any credentials to ask and answer this question which is exactly what Marina has done here. Then she answers with her usual hostility and disgusting language to other Quora users. I don’t think Michael would have liked it . It means she is provoking people on Quora and using Quora as a personal debate and attack site. Below is a screen shot of the log where she asks and answers her own question here which is merely provoking other users to engage in hate talk . It’s available to everyone under Stats. I don’t understand the benefits of personally attacking other users or being nasty and vulgar to them in the cause of loving Michael Jackson. I read a comment on another question where she attacked another user( not me) of “writing and reading about mj and pretending to like him but hates him because he is a legend and she is a NOBODY” . When the person complained of the hate talk Marina commented “I was right you are a NOBODY “ Quora is an information sharing site, not a fandom site so this line of questioning is not appropriate. If you want to trash other users go to a fandom site. People who talk like that to others create a toxic fan community that's best avoided, which is why I do. A lot of people you think are haters just disagree with a very toxic fandom community that had sprung up around Mj deification . So i think its time to take a break as personal vendettas on a topic are boring and pointless. I met Michael Jackson briefly twice in life. I was married to someone who worked in theater in NYC for 22 years who introduced me . Michael didn’t seem hate worthy, he seemed kinda sweet if you met him briefly in a casual way, but he did seem a bit crazy. But so do half the people in NYC so not exactly a big deal. Below are the stats. Provoking others     Speaking of haters..this is no way to answer a question. What a hypocrite!!! Damn!!      Haters:

Haters gonna hate! I don’t mind if people don’t like his music, everyone’s got different tastes. But I just HATE it when: you present them with factual evidence and they just deny it. Stating their one and only argument “oh but you think it’s normal for a grown ass man to sleep with children on the same bed” it’s like they refuse to look into both sides of the story, instead, they stay entitled to their own opinion.Some of them go to any length to ridicule and trash him, by making offensive memes, films (u know that scene in SM3) videos, video games (u know what I’m talking about) to creating sites that are dedicated to prove his guilt (again, u know that one). I get that you think he’s guilty, you have your reasons, I have mine, but it hurts to see people making a joke out of him. It’s unecessary.They’re calling us -fans- peadophile enablers/ apologists, when they’re the peadophile enablers themselves. Believing in Michael’s guilt, is believing in Victor Gutirrez’s narrative of normalizing peadophilia, and thus, supporting peadophiles.When asked about Michael Jackson, they only recall bad things. I’m pretty sure that the only images printed in their head about MJ are the tabloid edited ones, in their mind, he’s a freak, a monster, w**ko j**ko, a weirdo…So sad. Get a life and stop hating.The “I used to be a fan but after watching the doco I can no longer defend him” folks. No, just no. If you were a true fan, you would at least try to look into both sides? Do some research instead of jumping to conclusion? Whatever, glad you left the fandom, we don’t need tabloid hoarders like you anyways.They only think of Michael as a paedophile who got away with it. They act as if they know Michael personally and are 100% sure of his guilt, they’d be like “he did it, it’s hard to believe but I’m certain he did it” wtf? How would you know that? Your guts? Unless you have some strong evidence that you won’t mind sharing with us? Meanwhile, we are 100% sure of his innocence, and that’s because we have all evidence and facts to back it up.Then there are those who hate him because of his appearence, eccentric behavior…regardless of false charges. I don’t deal with those people, and I don’t have to. There’s no point in arguing with them or forcing them to like MJ no no no. Michael made mistakes, yes, some stupid mistakes. He’s no angel or saint, he’s not a devil either. He’s a human being. You can say whatever you wanna say about him, just don’t accuse him of molesting kids, you’re striking a nerve there. (For me at least)
